title: Experimental Process for Polymer Nanomicelle Fabrication and Characterization Research

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Polymer Chemistry, Experimental Techniques (Synthesis and Analysis), Introduction to Nanomaterials
context.additional_context: Integrates theoretical and practical competencies through research-based experiments in smartphone-centered limited-technology environments, offering personalized feedback and enhancing small-group collaboration

learning_goals: Learners can design and execute a nanomicelle manufacturing process using block copolymers.
Learners can evaluate the physicochemical properties of nanomicelles using analytical instruments such as DLS, TEM, and DSC.

Learners visualize experimental data in tables/graphs/charts over six months, write 10-page research reports following a five-stage structure (introduction-methods-results-discussion-conclusion), and derive three or more scientific implications from experimental results.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
